member.summary: Represents a collection of bytes.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of ByteCollection class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value of a byte

member.summary: Adds a byte into the collection.

member.summary: Adds a range of bytes to the collection.
member.param: the bytes to add

member.summary: Removes a byte from the collection.

member.summary: Removes a range of bytes from the collection.

member.summary: Inserts a range of bytes to the collection.

an array of bytes to insert

member.summary: Gets all bytes in the array

member.summary: Inserts a byte to the collection.

a byte to insert

member.summary: Returns the index of the given byte.

member.summary: Returns true, if the byte exists in the collection.

member.summary: Copies the content of the collection into the given array.

member.summary: Copies the content of the collection into an array.
member.returns: the array containing all bytes.

member.name: T:HexBoxForm.DynamicFileByteProvider
member.summary: Implements a fully editable byte provider for file data of any size.
member.remarks: Only changes to the file are stored in memory with reads from the original data occurring as required.

member.summary: Contains the text that should be found.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Find options are valid

member.summary: Gets the Find buffer used for case insensitive Find operations. This is the binary representation of Text.

member.summary: Gets the Find buffer used for case sensitive Find operations. This is the binary representation of Text in lower case format.

member.name: P:HexBoxForm.FindOptions.FindBufferUpperCase
member.summary: Gets the Find buffer used for case sensitive Find operations. This is the binary representation of Text in upper case format.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value, whether the Find operation is case sensitive or not.

member.name: P:HexBoxForm.FindOptions.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text that should be found. Only used, when Type is FindType.Hex.

member.name: P:HexBoxForm.FindOptions.Hex
member.summary: Gets or sets the hex buffer that should be found. Only used, when Type is FindType.Hex.

member.summary: Gets or sets the type what should be searched.

member.summary: Updates the find buffer.

member.name: P:HexBoxForm.HexBox.ReadOnly

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum count of bytes in one line.
member.remarks: UseFixedBytesPerLine property no longer has to be set to true for this to work

member.name: P:HexBoxForm.HexBox.GroupSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of bytes in a group. Used to show the group separator line (if GroupSeparatorVisible is true)
member.remarks: GroupSeparatorVisible property must set to true

member.name: P:HexBoxForm.HexBox.UseFixedBytesPerLine
member.summary: Gets or sets if the count of bytes in one line is fix.
member.remarks: When set to True, BytesPerLine property determine the maximum count of bytes in one line.

member.name: M:HexBoxForm.HexBox.ConvertBytesToHex(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Converts a byte array to a hex string. For example: {10,11} = "0A 0B"
member.param: the byte array
member.returns: the hex string

member.name: M:HexBoxForm.HexBox.ConvertByteToHex(System.Byte)
member.summary: Converts the byte to a hex string. For example: "10" = "0A";
member.param: the byte to format
member.returns: the hex string

member.name: M:HexBoxForm.HexBox.ConvertHexToBytes(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the hex string to an byte array. The hex string must be separated by a space char ' '. If there is any invalid hex information in the string the result will be null.
member.param: the hex string separated by ' '. For example: "0A 0B 0C"
member.returns: the byte array. null if hex is invalid or empty

member.summary: Inserts bytes into the provider

member.summary: Deletes bytes from the provider

member.remarks: This method must raise the LengthChanged event.

member.summary: Occurs, when the Length property changed.

member.name: E:HexBoxForm.IByteProvider.Changed
member.summary: Occurs, when bytes are changed.

member.summary: Contains true, if we are in design mode of Visual Studio

member.summary: Initializes an instance of Util class

member.name: P:HexBoxForm.Util.DesignMode
member.summary: Gets true, if we are in design mode of Visual Studio
member.remarks: In Visual Studio 2008 SP1 the designer is crashing sometimes on windows forms. The DesignMode property of Control class is buggy and cannot be used, so use our own implementation instead.
